title: Configure OPTIC Switcher
content:
OPTIC Switcher offers ITOM users a seamless navigation experience via OPTIC One, enabling quick transitions between various applications without the need to return to the home screen. It provides a one-click access point for all your applications from a centralized location. This topic describes how to configure this feature.

Enable OPTIC Switcher in OPTIC One

Before you start, you need to enable OPTIC Switcher in OPTIC One and configure the system settings to display the switching applications on the right side of the masthead. See Configure OPTIC Switcher for instructions.

Configure OPTIC Switcher in Service Management

  1. Log in to Service Management Suite Administration: https://<SMAX_host>/bo
  2. Select the Service Management tenant where OPTIC Switcher needs to be configured.
  3. Go to Application settings > OPTIC Switcher settings, and set the values as required:
    Base URL: Configure the base URL of OPTIC Switcher. For example: https://uis.coloryourdata.io, uis.coloryourdata.io, or https://uis.coloryourdata.io:1234
    Authentication configuration group in IdM: This field is only required after you configure Single Sign On. See the Configure Single Sign On section below for further instructions.
    OPTIC One tenant ID: The ID of the OPTIC One tenant from which OPTIC Switcher is loaded. If OPTIC One is deployed in a Provider tenant, leave this field empty.
  4. Save the changes.

Configure Single Sign On

If different IdMs are deployed in Service Management and OPTIC One, it's recommended that you follow the steps below to avoid additional login when launching OPTIC Switcher from Service Management (that is, to enable Single Sign On when launching OPTIC Switcher from Service Management). 

Configure SAML in IdM of Service Management and OPTIC One

.

Based on the above deployment, you need to configure SAML authentication for all Service Providers (SPs).

For Service Management,you may refer to the Add SAML authentication instructions. 

For OPTIC ONE, see Administer IDM. 

Configure authentication configuration group in OPTIC One IdM

If the OPTIC One IdM doesn't use SAML authentication as the default authentication service, you need to perform below configuration steps.

Create an authentication configuration group in OPTIC One IdM

  1. Log in to the IdM Administration console: https://<UIS_host>/idm-admin (For example, https://uis.coloryourdata.io/idm-admin) 
  2. Select the OPTIC Switcher One tenant as required.
  3. Select Authentication in the left navigation menu.
  4. Click    next to CONFIGURATION GROUPS to add a new configuration group.
    On the CONFIGURATION GROUPS page, enter the related configuration settings, and then click SAVE.
    Name: The name of this configuration group.
    Display Name: The display name of this configuration group.
    You may leave other optional fields as blank.
  5. Click    next to CONFIGURATIONS to add a new configuration configuration.
    Authentication type: Select the authentication type. For example, SAML
    Configuration group: Select the configuration group created in step 4.
  6. On the CONFIGURATION page, enter the related configuration settings, and then click SAVE.
    Name: The name of this configuration.
    Display Name: The display name of this configuration.
    Verify: Set as true.
    IDP Metadata: Drag the idm_saml_metadata.xml file that generated during OPTIC One configures SAML
  7. Log in to Service Management Suite Administration: https://<SMAX_host>/bo
  8. Select the Service Management tenant where OPTIC Switcher needs to be configured.
  9. Go to Application settings > OPTIC Switcher settings, and set Authentication configuration group in IdM with the configuration group name created in step 4.
  10. Save the changes.

Configure OPTIC Switcher in UCMDB

To enable OPTIC Switcher for UCMDB UI, follow these steps:

  1. Access UCMDB server JMX console, and locate UCMDB:service=Settings Services > setSettingValue.

  2. Invoke the setSettingValue JMX method with the following parameters to set the value for the OPTIC Switcher settings:

    customerID: Enter the ID of the customer where OPTIC Switcher needs to be configured (Default: 1).

    name: Enter the ID for one of the OPTIC Switcher settings (For example: uif.host). See the table below for the setting ID and description.

    value: Enter the setting value.

Setting ID Setting name Description
uif.host UI Foundation Server Host Name or IP address Specify the server host name or IP address of OPTIC Switcher.  For example: uis.coloryourdata.io
uif.port UI Foundation Server Port Specify the port of the OPTIC Switcher server. For example: 443
uif.root.context UI Foundation Server URL Root Context

Specify the server URL root context. For example: / 

Note: If you need to specify this setting, it must end with /. For example: /uis/
uif.tenant UI Foundation Tenant Name The ID of the OPTIC One tenant from which OPTIC Switcher is loaded. 
uif.idm.auth.group UI Foundation Authentication Configuration Group Name

Set the name of the authentication configuration group configured in the IdM of OPTIC One (Organization of OPTIC One > Authentication > Configuration Groups). 
uif.supported.minimum.version Supported UI Foundation minimum version Specify the supported minimum version of OPTIC One.

Use OPTIC Switcher

After configurations, you can use OPTIC Switcher to access other ITOM applications configured in OPTIC One.

  1. Log in to the Service Management Agent interface or UCMDB UI.
  2. Click the OPTIC Switcher  icon on the right side of the masthead.
  3. Select the application that you want to switch to.
